paper.title: The QUEST-approach for the performance evaluation of SDL-systems
paper.venue: Formal Techniques for (Networked and) Distributed Systems
paper.abstract: Designing complex systems requires formal methods supporting validation and performance evaluation before implementation. We present an approach based on the adjunction of queueing stations and traffic sources to SDL-systems yielding integrated models assessable by quantitative evaluation. As a consequence SDL-specifications may be used as a basis for performance evaluations of systems during the design phase. Apart from the underlying concept we introduce the language QSDL (Queuing SDL), and the QUEST tool that implement our approach. As an example we show how the performance of an SDL specified communication protocol may be investigated by employing QSDL and QUEST.
